description: How the action unfolded as Limavady United, Ards and Annagh shock Premiership opponents in the Irish Cup fifth round.
title: Shock defeats for Larne, Ballymena & Ports - Irish Cup as it happened
title_page: Irish Cup: Shock defeats for Larne, Ballymena & Ports - Irish Cup as it happened - BBC Sport
maintext:
Final whistle
What a day for Irish Cup upsets as Limavady stunned Larne, Ards beat Ballymena and Annagh defeated Mid-Ulster neighbours Portadown.
And there's no doubt what's the pick of the games in the sixth round with Glentoran hosting Linfield in a Big Two showdown.
That's all from us for now - we hope you enjoyed it.
Thanks for your company.
FULL-TIME
Limavady United 1-0 Larne
It's all over at the Limavady Showgrounds where a Ruairi Boorman goal deep into extra-time sends then Championship side through at the expense of the premiership champions.
Boorman struck five minutes from time when Larne failed to clear a free-kick into the heart of the box.
It's no less than the Roesiders deserve following a professional display against a disappointing Larne side.
Post
Limavady United 1-0 Larne
Limavady United are just minutes away from a famous cup upset following Ruairi Boorman's late goal.
Limavady United swung a free-kick in from the right wing, Larne 'keeper Rohan Ferguson failed to gather and Boorman was quickest to react, prodding home from close range to break the deadlock.
